data.name: Low Rate Card
data.description: Our Low Rate Card provides a low interest purchase rate plus a low annual card fee to help trim your credit card costs.

features.additionalInfo: You can add one additional cardholder (16 years or older) at no extra cost. The primary cardholder is liable for all transactions made with either card.

Balance Transfer promotion: 0% p.a. for 28 months on balance transfers, when requested at card application. 2% balance transfer fee applies. After 28 months any remaining balance transfer amount reverts to the variable cash advance rate. Eligible customers may only select one of the Low Rate Balance Transfer promotion and the Low Rate Cashback promotion.

Low Rate Cashback promotion: Up to $350 cashback - i.e $50 cashback will be awarded for every month $1,000 or more is spent on Eligible Purchases for the first 7 months from card approval. Valid between 2nd November 2023 and 30th April 2024. Eligible purchases do not include interest, fees, charges, cash or ATM cash advances, cash equivalent transactions, gambling transactions, a purchase from or payment to a local, state or federal government or government related agency, BPAY or similar transactions (such as Post Billpay), refunds and balance transfers debited to the card account.  Eligible customers may only select one of the Low Rate Balance Transfer promotion and the Low Rate Cashback promotion.
Tap and pay quickly and easily using Fitbit Pay.
Tap and pay quickly and easily using Garmin Pay.
Tap and pay quickly and easily using Apple Pay.
Tap and pay quickly and easily using Google Pay.
Tap and pay quickly and easily using Samsung Pay.

features.additionalValue: Know what to pay when - Set up Card Autopay or SMS payment reminders so you can stay on top of your spend and repayments.

features.additionalInfo: Make shopping and ordering online even more safe and secure with Westpac My Merchants. Westpac My Merchants lets you shop and order online without needing to share your card details, because your card number is replaced with a unique identification code called a 'digital token'. This digital token, which won't contain your personal information and is used by the merchant instead of your card number, helping protect you online.
The product includes extra repayments
Use our SmartPlan repayment planner to break large purchases or balances down into regular instalments while keeping interest-free days.
Easily set transaction and transfer limits to place tabs on your spending and tailor how you use your card.
Westpac PartPay: Split purchases into 4 payments with PartPay. T&Cs applies.
Westpac Fraud Money Back Guarantee ensures that any unauthorised transaction claims will be reimbursed provided that the cardholder has not contributed to the loss and contacted us promptly.
Minimum repayments : 2% of the closing balance outstanding, or $10; whichever is greater. If the closing balance is less than $10, it must be paid in full.

You can use your Card to make a Purchase or a Cash Advance or carry out a Balance Transfer from another Credit Card. You can use your Card in many places in Australia and around the world. Look for the Visa and Mastercard signs that match those shown on your Card. If your Card is accepted by a Merchant, branch or ATM provider you can use it to: Pay for Purchases, through payment terminals, e.g. at a shop, etc.  online, within a mobile app, by telephone,  through mail order Withdraw Cash, at an ATM,  at a Bank branch.
Recurring payments - You may authorise a Merchant to charge recurring payments to your Card automatically without requesting your authorisation on each occasion.

Confirming and authorising transactions :  There are a number of ways you may be able to confirm a transaction. These include: signing your name. Holding your Card in  front of a contactless payment device. Entering your PIN. Entering your Card details and any other information required.
Gambling blocks : If you wish to limit access to gambling services through the Card Account, please call us or log into your online banking and activate gambling block in the Card Services menu.

Statements : We will issue a statement for the Card Account to you every month unless the account has a balance of $10 or less and there has been no account activity in that month. You can choose to receive statements by mail or electronically.
Explore ShopBack offers from the Westpac app, or earn bonus Cashback when you shop via the Westpac Lounge on ShopBack. Terms & Conditions applies.

Helpful cashback offers with Westpac Extras - Enjoy cashback to your account on eligible transactions from well-known and loved brands ? from department stores and supermarkets to petrol stations, travel partners and more. Subject to Terms & Conditions, eligibility criteria applies
Customers can access their eligible Westpac cards and Apple?s ID&V security features within Apple Wallet. T&Cs apply.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Those having permanent residency in Australia/NZ OR being a non-resident or migrant and hold an acceptable Visa, with a minimum 1 year before expiry
Customer having a regular, verifiable Australian taxable income.
Customer having a fixed, verifiable residential address in Australia.

discounts.description: Low Rate First-Year Card Fee Waiver

eligibility.additionalInfo: Low Rate First-Year Card Fee Waiver is available when you apply and are approved for a new Low Rate credit card between�2nd November 2023 and 30th April 2024. After the first year, the $59 annual card fee will be debited to your account annually on the 12-month anniversary of the first transaction on your card account

fees.name: Foreign Transaction Fee
fees.additionalInfo:
Payable as a percentage of the Australian dollar value of any foreign transaction.
Applies for transactions in a foreign currency, or in Australian dollars but processed by an overseas merchant or financial institution.
Note: It may not always be clear to you that the Merchant or entity processing the transaction is located outside Australia.

fees.name: Missed Payment Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $15 each statement cycle that the minimum monthly payment is not paid by the statement due date.

fees.name: Overlimit Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $15.00 once per statement period if your credit card account was opened before 4 June 2012. No overlimit fee will be charged for personal credit card accounts opened on or after 4 June 2012.

fees.name: Credit Card Surcharge
fees.additionalInfo: In some instances, businesses may administer a ?surcharge? for credit card payments. Usually, these are a percentage fee of your purchase amount. Ask the merchant if a surcharge applies and how much it is before paying if you?re unsure.
